headline: Does Union Pacific's New Labor Agreements Signal a Turning Point for Stability and Costs at UNP?
summary: Union Pacific recently announced it has finalized long-term labor agreements with 11 unions, covering 12 crafts and representing 46% of its workforce, while also approving interim pay increases for two of its largest unions. This marks an important step toward enhanced labor stability and cost visibility, as the agreements include wage increases, expanded benefits, and new work rule changes for nearly half of its employees. We’ll now examine how Union Pacific’s progress on labor negotiations...
